abstract: Anyone interested in the campaign shenanigans in the United States, or la comédie politique française, might also be intrigued by the political tea leaves now being read in China. A Politburo member, Bo Xilai, who has been called the rock star of Chinese politics, is getting entangled in a strange nighttime appearance at a U.S. Consulate by a colleague, Wang Lijun, who has been called the Eliot Ness of China.
lead_paragraph: Anyone interested in the campaign shenanigans in the United States, or la comédie politique française, might also be intrigued by the political tea leaves now being read in China.

headline.main: What Now for the Rock Star of Chinese Politics?
